00057 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00058 #include <config.h>
00059 #include <stdio.h>
00060 #include <stdlib.h>
00061 #include <string.h>
00062 #include <library/line.h>
00063 
00064 static void
00065 Punt (char *mesg)
00066 {
00067   fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", mesg);
00068   exit (-1);
00069 }
00070 
00071 #define WHITE_SPACE(ch) ((ch==' ')||(ch=='\t')||(ch==''))
00072 
00073 /*
00074  *      Read one line from file.
00075  *      Skip empty lines.
00076  *      Compress all white spaces between words into single spaces.
00077  *      Terminate the line with \0
00078  *      Punt if the buffer is not large enough.
00079  *      Else, return 0 upon EOF.
00080  *      Otherwise, return 1;
00081  */
00082 int
00083 ReadLine (FILE * F, char buf[], int len)
00084 {
00085   int white_space;
00086   int ch, i;
00087   i = 0;
00088   white_space = 0;
00089   while ((ch = getc (F)) != EOF)
00090     {
00091       if ((i == 0) && (ch == '\n'))     /* skip over empty line */
00092         continue;
00093       if (ch == '\n')           /* exit loop upon EOLN */
00094         break;
00095       if (WHITE_SPACE (ch))
00096         {                       /* do nothing for white spaces */
00097           white_space = 1;
00098         }
00099       else
00100         {
00101           if ((i != 0) && white_space)
00102             {
00103               buf[i++] = ' ';
00104               if (i >= len)
00105                 Punt ("ReadLine: buffer overflows");
00106             }
00107           buf[i++] = ch;
00108           if (i >= len)
00109             Punt ("ReadLine: buffer overflows");
00110           white_space = 0;
00111         }
00112     }
00113   buf[i] = '\0';
00114   if (i == 0)
00115     return 0;                   /* EOF */
00116   return 1;
00117 }
00118 /*
00119  *      Read one word from file.
00120  *      Skip over white spaces.
00121  *      Punt if the buffer is not large enough.
00122  *      Else, return 0 upon EOF.
00123  *      Otherwise, return 1.
00124  */
00125 int
00126 ReadWord (FILE * F, char buf[], int len)
00127 {
00128   int ch, i;
00129   /*
00130    *  Skip over white spaces first.
00131    */
00132   while ((ch = getc (F)) != EOF)
00133     {                           /* stop when EOF has been reached */
00134       if (ch == '\n')           /* skip over EOLN */
00135         continue;
00136       if (!WHITE_SPACE (ch))
00137         {                       /* read until a non-white-space */
00138           ungetc (ch, F);
00139           break;
00140         }
00141     }
00142   if (ch == EOF)
00143     return 0;
00144   i = 0;
00145   while ((ch = getc (F)) != EOF)
00146     {
00147       if ((ch == '\n') || WHITE_SPACE (ch))
00148         break;
00149       buf[i++] = ch;
00150       if (i >= len)
00151         Punt ("ReadWord: buffer overflows");
00152     }
00153   buf[i] = '\0';
00154   if (i == 0)
00155     return 0;                   /* EOF */
00156   return 1;
00157 }
00158 /*
00159  *      Find the starting point of each word in the line.
00160  *      Returns -1 if the buffer is not large enough.
00161  *      Otherwise, returns the number of words found.
00162  */
00163 int
00164 ParseLine (char *line, char *buf[], int len)
00165 {
00166   int i, n;
00167   i = n = 0;
00168   while (line[i] != '\0')
00169     {
00170       /*
00171        *      Skip over white-spaces.
00172        */
00173       while (WHITE_SPACE (line[i]))
00174         i++;
00175       if (line[i] == '\0')
00176         break;
00177       buf[n++] = (line + i);
00178       if (n >= len)
00179         Punt ("ParseLine: buffer overflows");
00180       /*
00181        *      Go to the next white space.
00182        */
00183       while ((line[i] != '\0') && !WHITE_SPACE (line[i]))
00184         i++;
00185     }
00186   buf[n] = 0;
00187   return n;
00188 }
00189 /*
00190  *      Find the starting point of each word in the line.
00191  *      Returns -1 if the buffer is not large enough.
00192  *      Otherwise, returns the number of words found.
00193  *      Make each word a separate string.
00194  */
00195 int
00196 ParseLine2 (char *line, char *buf[], int len)
00197 {
00198   int i, n;
00199   i = n = 0;
00200   while (line[i] != '\0')
00201     {
00202       /*
00203        *      Skip over white-spaces.
00204        */
00205       while (WHITE_SPACE (line[i]))
00206         i++;
00207       if (line[i] == '\0')
00208         break;
00209       buf[n++] = (line + i);
00210       if (n >= len)
00211         Punt ("ParseLine: buffer overflows");
00212       /*
00213        *      Go to the next white space.
00214        */
00215       while ((line[i] != '\0') && !WHITE_SPACE (line[i]))
00216         i++;
00217       if (line[i] == '\0')
00218         break;
00219       line[i] = '\0';
00220       i++;
00221     }
00222   buf[n] = 0;
00223   return n;
00224 }
00225 /*
00226  *      Return 1 if the first part of the word
00227  *      totally match the prefix.
00228  */
00229 int
00230 MatchPrefix (char *line, char *prefix)
00231 {
00232   int len, i;
00233   len = strlen (prefix);
00234   if (strlen (line) < len)
00235     return 0;
00236   for (i = 0; i < len; i++)
00237     if (line[i] != prefix[i])
00238       return 0;
00239   return 1;
00240 }
00241 /* 
00242  *      Return 1 if pattern matches name; 
00243  *      otherwise return 0. 
00244  *      Wildcard character is allowed in pattern. 
00245  *      ? matches any one character.
00246  *      * matches from 1 to N characters. 
00247  */
00248 int
00249 WildcardMatch (char *pattern, char *name)
00250 {
00251   if ((name[0] == '\0') && (pattern[0] == '\0'))
00252     return 1;
00253   if (pattern[0] == '?')
00254     {
00255       return WildcardMatch (pattern + 1, name + 1);
00256     }
00257   else if (pattern[0] == '*')
00258     {
00259       int i;
00260       i = 1;
00261       if ((name[1] == '\0') && (pattern[1] == '\0'))
00262         return 1;
00263       while (name[i] != '\0')
00264         {
00265           /*
00266            * find the next possible starting point in name 
00267            * that matches the rest of the pattern.
00268            */
00269           while ((name[i] != '\0') && (name[i] != pattern[1])
00270                  && (pattern[1] != '*') && (pattern[1] != '?'))
00271             i += 1;
00272           if (WildcardMatch (pattern + 1, name + i))
00273             return 1;
00274           i += 1;
00275         }
00276       return 0;
00277     }
00278   else if (pattern[0] == name[0])
00279     {
00280       return WildcardMatch (pattern + 1, name + 1);
00281     }
00282   else
00283     return 0;
00284 }
00285 /*
00286  *      Remove the last field from the source string.
00287  *      Return 1 if successful, Return 0 if not successful
00288  *      for any reason.
00289  *      If the seperator character does not appear in the
00290  *      source string, then the result is an empty string,
00291  *      and 1 is returned.
00292  */
00293 int
00294 RemovePostfix (char src[], char seperator, char buf[], int buf_len)
00295 {
00296   register int src_len, i, j;
00297   src_len = strlen (src);
00298   buf[0] = 0;                   /* default result is an empty string */
00299   if (src_len == 0)
00300     return 1;                   /* nothing needs to be done */
00301   for (i = src_len - 1; i >= 0; i--)    /* find the seperator */
00302     if (src[i] == seperator)
00303       break;
00304   if (i < 0)
00305     return 1;                   /* the entire src is deleted */
00306   if (buf_len <= i)
00307     return 0;                   /* buffer is not long enough */
00308   for (j = 0; j < i; j++)
00309     buf[j] = src[j];
00310   buf[j] = '\0';
00311   return 1;
00312 }
00313 /*
00314  *      Remove the first field from the source string.
00315  *      Return 1 if successful, Return 0 if not successful
00316  *      for any reason.
00317  *      If the seperator character does not appear in the
00318  *      source string, then the result is an empty string,
00319  *      and 1 is returned.
00320  */
00321 int
00322 RemovePrefix (char src[], char seperator, char buf[], int buf_len)
00323 {
00324   register int src_len, i, j, k;
00325   buf[0] = '\0';
00326   src_len = strlen (src);
00327   for (i = 0; i < src_len; i++) /* find the first seperator */
00328     if (src[i] == seperator)
00329       break;
00330   j = src_len - (i + 1);        /* number of char needs to be copied */
00331   if (j >= buf_len)
00332     return 0;
00333   for (k = 0; k <= j; k++)
00334     buf[k] = src[i + k + 1];
00335   buf[k] = '\0';
00336   return 1;
00337 }
00338 /*
00339  *      Extract the first field from the source string.
00340  *      Return 1 if successful, Return 0 if not successful
00341  *      for any reason.
00342  *      If the seperator character does not appear in the
00343  *      source string, then the result is the src string.
00344  */
00345 int
00346 GetPrefix (char src[], char seperator, char buf[], int buf_len)
00347 {
00348   register char *ch;
00349   register int i;
00350   i = 0;
00351   for (ch = src; (*ch != seperator) && (*ch != '\0'); ch++)
00352     {
00353       if (i >= buf_len)
00354         {
00355           buf[buf_len - 1] = '\0';
00356           return 0;
00357         }
00358       buf[i] = *ch;
00359       i += 1;
00360     }
00361   buf[i] = '\0';
00362   return 1;
00363 }

00366 #ifdef DEBUG_LINE
00367 int
00368 main (void)
00369 {
00370   char line[512];
00371   char *ptr[100];
00372   int i, j;
00373 
00374   RemovePostfix ("f:9:ccode", ':', line, 512);
00375   printf ("%s\n", line);
00376 
00377   RemovePostfix ("abc:def", ':', line, 512);
00378   printf ("%s\n", line);
00379   RemovePostfix (":abc:", ':', line, 512);
00380   printf ("%s\n", line);
00381   RemovePostfix ("abc:def:ghi", ':', line, 512);
00382   printf ("%s\n", line);
00383   RemovePostfix ("abc.def.ghi", ':', line, 512);
00384   printf ("%s\n", line);
00385 
00386   RemovePrefix ("abc:def", ':', line, 512);
00387   printf ("%s\n", line);
00388   RemovePrefix (":abc:", ':', line, 512);
00389   printf ("%s\n", line);
00390   RemovePrefix ("abc:def:ghi", ':', line, 512);
00391   printf ("%s\n", line);
00392   RemovePrefix ("abc.def.ghi", ':', line, 512);
00393   printf ("%s\n", line);
00394 
00395 /****
00396 #define M(x, y) WildcardMatch(x, y)
00397         printf("%d\n", M("abc", "abc"));
00398         printf("%d\n", M("abcd", "abc"));
00399         printf("%d\n", M("abc", "abcd"));
00400         printf("%d\n", M("ab?d", "abcd"));
00401         printf("%d\n", M("a*d", "abcd"));
00402         printf("%d\n", M("a*d", "abce"));
00403         printf("%d\n", M("a*de", "abcdfdde"));
00404         printf("%d\n", M("ab?", "abc"));
00405         printf("%d\n", M("ab*", "abc"));
00406         printf("%d\n", M("a?*", "abc"));
00407         printf("%d\n", M("a**", "abc"));
00408         printf("%d\n", M("*", "abc"));
00409         printf("%d\n", M("a*d", "ad"));
00410         printf("%d\n", M("???", "abc"));
00411         printf("%d\n", M("***", "abc"));
00412         printf("%d\n", M("*?*", "abc"));
00413         printf("%d\n", M("**?", "abc"));
00414 ****/
00415 /***
00416         while (ReadWord(stdin, line, 512) != 0) {
00417             printf("> %s\n", line);
00418         }
00419  ***/
00420 /****
00421         while (ReadLine(stdin, line, 512) != 0) {
00422             printf("> %s\n", line);
00423             i = ParseLine(line, ptr, 100);
00424             for (j=0; j<i; j++) {
00425                 printf("# %s\n", ptr[j]);
00426             }
00427         }
00428 ****/
00429 
00430   return 0;
00431 }
